paper.title: Phase-curve Evidence for an Atmosphere on TRAPPIST-1 b

core_question: Does TRAPPIST-1 b possess a detectable atmosphere, and what are its properties?

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Observed System
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Phase-resolved thermal spectra of TRAPPIST-1 b obtained with JWST MIRI.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Null Scenario
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Bare-rock, no-atmosphere model with minimal heat redistribution used as baseline.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: CO2-rich Atmosphere
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Atmosphere model with significant CO2 absorption and moderate pressure.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: O2-rich Atmosphere
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Oxidized composition scenario with weaker CO2 signature constraints.

major_limitations: Single‑planet study does not establish atmospheric prevalence across M‑dwarf rocky planets.
Retrieval assumptions (circulation, opacity priors, cloud treatment) affect quantitative posteriors.
Stellar variability and instrument systematics can bias weak spectral features.
